name: The Perfect C and W Song Trivia Game | Country Music by Year | 10 Questions

questions.text: What song is considered the 'Perfect Country and Western Song'?
questions.correct: You Never Even Called Me By My Name
options: The Night the Lights Went Out in Georgia
questions.explanation: You Never Even Called Me By My Name.

questions.text: Which singer made the 'Perfect Country and Western Song' famous?
In the song it mentions the writer, who is the writer of the song?
questions.explanation:
Steve Goodman.

	My friend Steve Goodman wrote this song and said it was the perfect Country and Western song.

questions.text: The song mentions 3 Country star besides the singer. Which of the following people is not mentioned in the song?
The singer says that he will hear his name only once. Who will say his name?
options: Only if he says his name himself
questions.explanation:
Jesus.

	The only time I'll hear David Allan Coe is when Jesus...

questions.text: Fill in the blank. You don't have to call me ______________.
questions.explanation:
Darling & Darlin.

	You don't have to call me darling, darling. You never even call me by my name.

questions.text: Fill In The Blank. The singer of this song sends the song back to the writer and says 'This is not the perfect Country and Western song because It doesn't mentioned anything about Mama, trains, trucks, prison, or getting _________'
So after the song writer received the message from the singer he wrote some new lyrics. The last 3 questions regard these new lyrics. Who did the singer go to pick up from prison in the rain?
questions.explanation:
Mom & Mama & Mother & Momma.

	I was drunk when my mom got out of prison.

questions.text: What type of transportation did the singer go to the prison to pick the person up in?
questions.explanation:
Pickup Truck.

	But by the time I could get to the station in my pickup truck.

questions.text: Finish the lyric. 'She got runned over by a damned old _________.'
questions.explanation:
Train.

	Here is the complete new lyrics. I was drunk when my mom got out of prison. I went to pick her up in the rain, but before I could get to the station in my pickup truck, she got runned over by a damned old train.
